title: leaver buster (i think) on client crashing/freezing
body:
So I figure that there is dead to nothing you can do about it but every once in a while the client crashes while im in champ select. I get a short ban and its no big deal. but today It's happened multiple times (twice so far I just realized how exaggerative I was) and im up to 15 minute waits... I have no clue but could there be some sort of feature youd be able to add some point down the road that only puts a 5 minute ban on people who crash during champ select? 

as im writing this complaint (yes I realize im just complaining cause im so damn impatient to wait 15 minutes) I just realize im doing it in the boards... ill go write in "ask" or maybe the support ticket page will at least read it. Derp :P

But yeah I get that maybe the problem is on my end but I kinda got a highpowered custom made desktop and I ran a scan for viruses and double checked my internet connection... my client just crashes every once in a while (usually after a big update) and its kinda lame that I gotta wait 15 minutes (half a league match) just to start one due to a problem that from my perspective isn't my fault. then again it could be but I did all the basic troubleshooting except deleting and re-downloading. but whens the last time you delete a big download just to spend 3 hours watching it redownload and it still have the same problem. I did it just the other day ill tell you that.

replies.body: Same. I have a high-end gaming computer only a few months old, far beyond the requirements for this game. Often in champ select (and also when the game ends and swaps to the post game lobby) the client will crash. I'm tired of being given 15+ minute queue penalties for a technical problem caused by the client's coding.  It's killing my enjoyment of the game, and I know we are far from alone.

Most of the time its not due to your PC but instead due to internet connection.

Crashes in champ select are often caused by an unstable connection to the servers. When the client experiences a drop in connection to the server, it can cause delays in what you see in champ select or crash the client entirely. Since it's possible to have a good connection to one site or service, but not another, there may be some local configurations causing issues for you in League. Our [connection guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) goes over the most common solutions for improving your connection. 

Let me know if you continue to see the issues after working through this guide.
